org.openimaj.image.feature.local.keypoints

Class Keypoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.feature.local.keypoints.Keypoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, FeatureVectorProvider<ByteFV>, LocalFeature<KeypointLocation,ByteFV>, LocalFeatureVectorProvider<KeypointLocation,ByteFV>, LocationProvider<KeypointLocation>, Readable, ReadableASCII, ReadableBinary, ReadWriteable, VariableLength, Writeable, WriteableASCII, WriteableBinary, Coordinate, Point2d, ScaleSpacePoint
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AffineSimulationKeypoint, InterestPointKeypoint, MinMaxKeypoint

    public class Keypoint
extends Object
implements Serializable, ScaleSpacePoint, LocalFeature<KeypointLocation,ByteFV>, VariableLength, Cloneable
    A local interest point with a location, scale, orientation and associated feature. The feature is stored as an array of bytes.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                                                  float x,
                                                  float y)
        Create a list of Keypoints from the input list, but with the positions offset by the given amount.

      • addGaussianNoise

        public static List<Keypoint> addGaussianNoise(List<Keypoint> siftFeatures,
                                              double mean,
                                              double sigma)
        Add Gaussian noise the feature vectors of some features. The original features are untouched; the returned list contains a copy.
        Parameters:
        siftFeatures - the input features
        mean - the mean of the noise
        sigma - the standard deviation of the noise
        Returns:
        the noisy keypoints

      • getScaledKeypoints

        public static List<Keypoint> getScaledKeypoints(List<Keypoint> keypoints,
                                                int toScale)
        Scale a list of keypoints by the given amount. This scales the location and scale of each keypoint. The original features are untouched; the returned list contains a copy.
        Parameters:
        keypoints - the input features.
        toScale - the scale factor
        Returns:
        the scaled features.
